intro: Chisocheton pauciflorus, commonly known as the few-flowered chisocheton, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It typically grows as a small tree or shrub, often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
